website_summaries.verdict: Folds down to a tiny 14-inch length, making it perfect for packing for traveling.
pros: Nice quality of ball head, so you can create the perfect angle for the shot
Only weighs 2.9 pounds, and you’ll be able to hike or travel with it easily
Uses flip locks on the leg sections, which allows for quick adjustments
Able to support up to 26 pounds of gear, which is more than enough for most photographers
cons: Limited to a maximum working height of 56 inches, so it’s not as big as some other similarly priced options

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this tripod is great. I work in TV and this tripod works ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this tripod is great. I work in TV and this tripod works better than most of expensive tripods I use at work. I haven't had any issues with it holding up my Nikon D7200 with a Tamron 150-600mm lens on it. Its very sturdy and does what its supped to do. I use it mostly for moon shots while using a remote.
customer_reviews.author: B. Muscari

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, breaks apart easily
customer_reviews.text: Used the this tripod for about 3 months and was pretty happy with it. Then one day I pull the tripod out of the carrying case and one of the legs was completely loose and useless. One of the screws has bent and stripped the threads on the leg. How is this even possible? See the picture attached. Wouldn’t recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tommyd12

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control. Not as advertised as well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews. After I got it I quickly noticed it did not extend to the advertised height. In fact was nearly 1’ short. The machining of the dovetails and squareness was not plumb. The machine was sloppy enough that is caused creep in the head and had to compensate for this. The horizontal axis was a little sloppy as well. Overall is is somewhat useful but was return for poor workmanship.......the bag was nice though Purchased another tripod
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great travel tripod
customer_reviews.text: Easy to travel with, has solid grid to hold the camera with moderate lenses, can work as a monopod also and great price. All in all exactly what i was looking for a travel tripod and got very good result out of it(see pics)
customer_reviews.author: Atanu C.

customer_reviews.title: 3 months, 1 trip and it broke
customer_reviews.text: I only use it twice on a recent trip. It was fine until I took it out recently and one of the legs won't open up. Turns out the suspension is broken! I'm a professional photographer and knew immediately that it is the quality of it that renders it broken. I've had tripods for 20 years and they are still working. This tripod is great for holidays, so I thought. Now that it has been 3 months since I got it, I can't get a refund. I won't recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Teng Eng

customer_reviews.title: Quick Release Plate is not universal - therefore, not a good choice for Pro's
customer_reviews.text: The Quick Release Plate is not universal and they don't sell them separately, so if you want to switch between cameras quickly, this is not a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Made from cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Broke after first trip, I bought this for a safari trip To Africa and for the first time I took my tripod with me as a carryon since I thought it was light.. I used it several times and tooks some awesome photos but it always felt light and like my camera would fall off. However I came back and all was still Ok. The other day I had a family photo shoot the moment I started to open the legs to make them long the clasp broke.. now I need to use a screw drive to release the clasp.. seems I will go back to my manfrotto
customer_reviews.author: Lamki

customer_reviews.title: Loose neck with lot of play
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this first tripod after comparing to similar products. Got this in the lightening deal. There is a lot of play in the neck/pivot point and is very annoying. I tried to loosen and retighten everything but still very loose. Oh well another product in the trash
customer_reviews.author: eyespye

customer_reviews.title: It's a bird...it's a plane..its a very nice converible monopole or tripod for your DLSR
customer_reviews.text: It's a bird...it's a plane.. its can serve as a walking stick or ninja-like striking stick.. It can also safely hold your pricey DLSR or Video Camera. Very fine quality, easy to adjust, offering a full range of flexible shooting support features. A bag is included for stowing it when not in use. It looks cool just sitting there. Honestly there may be better ones but I didn't see a reason to explore the market sector further. It's perfect for suspending my Panasonic FZ1000 sideways, upside-down, or any contorted angle in between and is stable...there is an accommodation for suspending additional weighting below the head for additional assurance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: An okay tripod when you have nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: The tripod is okay but not that great. It is pretty flimsy and makes using it for macro photography or low light photography almost impossible. The slightest breeze will cause minor movement which is enough to be noticed at low shutter speeds or when up close with a macro. If you are using it for landscaping and other methods with a faster speed, it does the job though. Having a Sony A7RII on it with a 100mm lens, I do not trust the tripod to not just fall over. There are must better options for the same price or spend more for a higher quality tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C

customer_reviews.title: Center Leg Height Adjustment Problem
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely difficult to pull the extension of the center leg to increase the height. This usually happened when I really need to increase the height - I got really frustrated when people are waiting to be photographed, and I just can't set up the tripod. Sometimes it'll work flawlessly, and then the next minute when I need to make adjustment, it won't move at all. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: CyberChang

customer_reviews.title: It is nice because it's compact
customer_reviews.text: Really flimsy if it is at any usable height and your camera will shake if you touch it even slightly. It is nice because it's compact, but if you need something sturdy and cheap, the Amazon Basics tripods are just as good, if not better, and 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon ulasien

customer_reviews.title: Heavy for a compact tripod, but not bad
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to bring a tripod on vacation, bought this, opened it, never used it and decided to leave it behind. I could not justify It’s 2+ lbs. and not-so-compact profile, which would have forced me to check a bag or sacrifice other items to maintain carry-on weight constraints. The construction is not sturdy enough to be considered a go-to, main tripod, nor is it compact and light enough to really tote around as a travel or “compact”. It’s a solid in-between, semi-compact tripod you can throw in the trunk of the car and take on short hikes and day trips to the beach or whatever. If that wasn’t a catagory before, now it is.
customer_reviews.author: TheBagramExperience

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger, heavier tripod I use for serious studio and local field work, but I needed one for travel and other light weight uses such as hiking, etc... This tripod is exactly what I was looking for...not too heavy, compact enough for back-pack or luggage, yet sturdy enough for my Nikon with various lenses (some quite large and heavy)....also reasonably priced for the excellent quality of it....a pretty good deal. Just today, used it to shoot some antiquated grave stones here in Providence RI....many of which are rather small and low to the ground....This tripod was perfect for lining my lens up with stones less than 12' tall...Very nice....Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Babyboomer

customer_reviews.title: best option for the price
customer_reviews.text: Buy it if , like me, you don't want to spend $100+ dollars on tripod but at same time you are afraid anything below that level would be of such horrible quality that it would feel like money thrown away. I did my research, and decided to trust reviews which say it's the best tripod you can get in that price range. Now having used it couple times I must agree. Not the best tripod out there, but definitely best option under $100. No complaints regarding manufacturing quality. Smooth head movement and the whole tripod feels sturdy for it's weight. Packs small and weight is not a burden when you take it with you hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: I like it! A lot! I can't wait to get it out in the field. The only feature that it's missing is a transverse center column, but it's not a deal breaker. It seams to support my 90D and Sigma 150-500mm DG pretty well - I did notice a little deflection in the legs if I moved the camera and lens "vigorously," but I think it'll be fine - I don't believe the camera will ever move in that manner in the field. The tripod is indeed light, compact and very packable. I can leave my much bigger, barely packable tripod at home now. First impression - outstanding value! I'm glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stranathan

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive tripod that hold up with use
customer_reviews.text: Like this because it’s inexpensive and lite. Has held up through some pretty hard usage without any problems. Really like the monopod and use it a lot. Folds up compactly and fits in the backpack. Really made a difference in the photos I take with my 300mm lens as I’m getting to that age when even the anti vibration sensor of the lens doesn’t do the trick. As I do mainly outdoor photography I still have some problems getting sharp focus, but this tripod/monopod helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: wrygrass

customer_reviews.title: Has a hard time holding position under weight
customer_reviews.text: I mounted my 90D Canon with 70-300mm lens and in order to hold positioning I had to focus about 2 - 3" above my target and crank the locking knobs down so it would settle on my subject area. It does not like it when there is more than a couple of pounds off center. I do manage to use it, just be aware of your balance/center of gravity with this tri-pod.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months of light use, the upper stem tube, just underneath the ball head is stuck. So it won't extend all the way up anymore. I was expecting a better quality for this price. --- Update --- After I posted the original review above, the seller responded very quickly and sent me a replacement tripod with in few days. It was unbelievable. Very pleased with the service.
customer_reviews.author: frehman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, well-made tripod.
customer_reviews.text: This tripod cannot be beat for the price. I was surprised that there are a few bad reviews. It is very well made, sturdy, and compact. It is slightly heavier than I was anticipated, but considering I’m how well made it is that has to be acceptable. The only poorly made part was the extra extension (not same material as rest of tripod) which I do not even need nor did I expect, so no complaints there. Came with a pouch also that I did not expect. Awesome tripod! You will not beat this tripod at this price
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Quite good! Actually, very good!
customer_reviews.text: I had my eye on another one that was even better, but it was in kickstarter mode too long, not to mention that the price was over $550. So I looked for a more reasonably priced one with nearly the same features. This one, happily, fit the bill. Fits in a suitcase for flights, does not weigh much, and is incredibly versatile. It even has a removable leg for the time you need a monopod. I am very excited to add this to my arsenal of tripods for the times I need to travel to lands far away.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kummerow

customer_reviews.title: nice product but...
customer_reviews.text: no quick camera release. Hove to turn camera to screw on or unscrew from the tripod head. Major inconvenience in some situations. Product details indicate 2 bubble levels on the ball head. the one on the platform locking know is not there. No instruction on preparation to stow the tripod. Need trial and etrror fo find head position least in conflict with completely folding the legs up. All that said, it appears to be a sturdy, well made product, if damaged I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: dave22q

customer_reviews.title: It's that rare product that seems to be designed and built by people who USE it.
customer_reviews.text: When I was shopping, I wondered if this was too pricey for a lightweight tripod. But after 18 months I'm glad I didn't "cheap out". I bought this for portability and versatility. It delivers on both. It's easy to fold into its zipper case and takes very little space. It's light, but stable for my DSLR long exposures at night. It's always my first choice tripod for all the conveniences. I'm sure this is my most traveled tripod. I see it has many clone competitors. I can't speak for them, but my TYCKA is like-new despite a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Shuster Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: One of the clamps was broken or broke off while removing from the package. Extremely poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great for mobility / travel
customer_reviews.text: my old Velbon tripod finally broke. the latch that secured the camera plate to tripod was plastic, and it broke, I bought that from a PX store on base, in late 1980. So, it was time to replace it. The Rangers is a nice replacement. it comes with a nice travel bag, and it folds up in a unique way, so it smaller to store it. Not as heavy made as the Velbon, but it really ok. I would recommend it. I don't like cheap stuff, and this should last many years, and go many miles!
customer_reviews.author: dan laws

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing on tons of trips and it worked great. It's as light as my more expensive VEO 2 and even sturdier. BUT man, this thing just falls apart on its own. I had to tighten the leg screws before every trip out, yet still lost a few. The weight hook on the bottom also broke. Reaching out to customer service, given the manufacturer warranty was confusing. I was never sent the parts I actually need and was eventually offered a full refund. I ended up moving to a different tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Sam H

customer_reviews.title: Well made, smooth motion, good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod to hold a DSLR or a DSLR and miniature astronomic tracking platform. This has the appropriate weight capacity and stiffness. You can remove the ball mount, leaving a 3/8 screw, or you can use the ARCA-compatible 1/4 plate ball mount on top. The tripod is well made. All parts move smoothly. I like the use of thumb cams on the legs to extend the legs. I like the positive detents to lock the legs at specific angles. My one critique (why 4 rather than 5 stars) is that the the choice of fixed angles for legs misses an intermediate angle between having too narrow and too wide tripod stance.
customer_reviews.author: Hy D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Does just what I've been looking for in a tripod. It's compact and light weight, so I don't hesitate taking it with me if I need to hike a few miles. Versitile, can be used as a monopod for getting the quick action shots; as a tripod it sets up in multiple configurations for a wide range of height and angle adjustments with great stability in all positions, it pans easily. The price is more than fair for such a well engineered piece of photo equipment. Very pleased and satisfied with this purchase, I'll be happy using this one for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: James L. Fairbourn

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight but still a great tripod
customer_reviews.text: So the description does state lightweight, therefore no surprises there. I love the portability of this tripod for travel photography. Would I use it full time in studio? No I would definitely use my professional grade tripod for client shoots in studio or on location. I purchased this as a Travel tripod for all around photography use. It is shorter than most tripods extension range, but for the price its an excellent option for a carry around tripod for those occasions when you don't want to lug around the weight and size of a more professional tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M

customer_reviews.title: SURPRINGLY GREAT TRIPOD!
customer_reviews.text: In my photos I have a Canon 5D Mark IV with a 24-105 lens. It held the weight with no issues. This tripod is so compact and light you wouldn't think it would really hold anything let alone be stable. What is also amazing about this tripod is that one of the legs unscrew to become a monopod!!! I put a lens cap next to the bag with the tripod folded up for a size comparison. GREAT tripod, can't wait to go out with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: great quality, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: ive used the mefoto travel tripods that this is based off of and theyre not much different considering the price. im used to heavy duty manfrotto tripods but just needed something to travel with and shoot the eclipse and this worked great. much better quailty than i thought. Id recommend these any day over the mefoto ones.
customer_reviews.author: Austin P.Top Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Good tripod bad head
customer_reviews.text: The tripod itself is great sturdy light lived up to all my expectations. The ballhead is junk lots of play like in other reviewers video. If your looking for a light complete setup look somewhere else. If your interested in just the tripod its great. Problem is if your going to get a diffrent ball head there are better options in the price range you will spend on getting this tripod and a good ball head
customer_reviews.author: yamkipor

customer_reviews.title: Great value tripod that does the job
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a great travel tripod, this tripod is excellent. I have a large carbon fiber tripod that I did not want to take with me to the Grand Canyon so I bought this one based on the reviews. Quality-wise, it's not the best. But for the price and what it is meant for, perfect! Very very function. It's not the tallest tripod so be prepared so you are not disappointed. It's max height is maybe a little over 5ft only. But it's super light and legs flip over the ballhead so it's very compact. Ballhead plus tripod for a cheap price. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: K-Trek

customer_reviews.title: A nice compact tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice compact tripod, the build quality is nice-excellent. The convertible to a monopod feature is a big plus. It comes with a nice carry bag, 2 pouches, 2 hex keys, and an extension tube. The manual is nicely printed but it had no mention of how to use the 2 pouches nor the extension tube and the information is not on the Rangers website neither. The locking mechanism on the legs are plastic, I have no clue how durable they are until extensive use. For the price point vs quality and feature sets, it is an excellent product for novice and intermediate photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood

customer_reviews.title: BROKE IN 5 MONTHS !
customer_reviews.text: This product broke in 5 months !!!! i really take care of my gear and it didnt last
customer_reviews.author: eli quezada

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and strong, great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tripod for over a year and find it to be every thing it is advertised to be. I was looking for a lightweight, but strong tripod for field trips. Carrying a tripod into the woods can get burdensome I wanted a tripod light to carry but strong enough to hold my Canon 50D. This tripod is strong and reliable. I am extrely happy with my purchase. The price was good also.
customer_reviews.author: J. Porcelli

customer_reviews.title: Can be the most expensive tripod you buy, when it drops your gear.
customer_reviews.text: If you value your camera and equipment what so ever, do not buy this tripod. New out of box I set it up quickly so that I could do some quick product photography. As soon as I placed my Nikon D750, with my Nikon 105mm lens, and loosened the screw to rotate it, the ball fell apart in my hand. I knew I was taking a chance by not buying another Manfroto, it is lightweight, but I do not trust the sturdiness of the product.
customer_reviews.author: James Garner

customer_reviews.title: Solid Buy for a Solid Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very solid design and function, all parts and components feel strong and well built. Certainly worth the extra 20 to 30 dollars rather then buying a mostly plastic cheaper tripod. Very very useful to have the legs adjust to a near horizontal position, great for macro shots and product photography. I find it is a good fit for using on a table top when shooting into a photo booth. Tripod comes with a well designed carrying bag (does not feel cheap and is built well), also comes with 2 hex wrenches for adjustments and gear satchel for accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I bought this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this tripod everywhere with me ever since I bought it. I really like the way it works and how portable it becomes once you fold it. I do think it is a great value for the money, and the fact it is a two in one makes it a great product. A con would be the fact that even when locking the ball head it moves a bit and you have to re-frame. All in all a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Aníbal Pozuelos Rodríguez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the mone!
customer_reviews.text: Just an excellent value for the money. This is not top of the line equipment, but fit and finish are surprisingly good for the money. One could get years of use out of this tripod. I especially appreciate the padded carrying case that comes with it. There is another bag thing with a little carabiner that no one knows what it does. One of the Q&A's said it was for holding a phone, but that is incorrect. Hey, other than that I would enthusiastically recommend this product. Good weight if you're attaching to a day pack like me.
customer_reviews.author: MikeNOVA

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: It's been years since I was overdue for a tripod upgrade, and this seemed to fit the bill. The price was affordable, it had what I was looking for in a tripod. I loved the fact that it can switch to monopod. I tested it out recently, oh my STARS!! my shots came out great and waayy better than what I was expecting. It is still in testing phase, I see great things coming from this tripod. It is slightly on the tough side to move the arms but not impossible, but in a way I can understand why they structured it to be like that in order to keep the camera steady.
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst Shyne

customer_reviews.title: Nice an compact
customer_reviews.text: I have tripods that can take an 8 x10 view camera. and I bet this compact tripod would work also. I bought so I wouldn't have to lug the bigger tripods when I am out shooting. This compact tripod work really nice with my DLSR Full frame camera. The tripods gimbal is rugged enough to handle the weight of a Pentax K1 with no problem. this thing folds up into nothing and is real easy to carry or attach to your camera bag. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I really like this new tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of ball head tripod. Previously I used a low cost Canon tripod. I have to say I really like this new tripod. It is very short when folded, and the weight is light enough to carry around and heavy enough to feel the quality. I am able to use my Canon 6D with lens on, but you do need to make sure you set the tripod right. The ball head is a delight as well. The only negative if I have to take one is that I would like the legs to extend out more to make it more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: joey X.

customer_reviews.title: By far THE best tripod I have purchased here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC tripod. It's priced fairly. The legs have a quick lock mechanism which let you setup faster than twist-types. Each part is sturdy and none of it feels cheap. The company is responsive to support questions and were very helpful when I wanted extra parts for my tripod. It is not as light as carbon fiber tripods but it is still fairly light enough to travel with. I love how you can transform this to monopods if you need it or even walking sticks. Really can't ask for more. It's also a very attractive package that is a pleasure to use. Overall very happy with this purchase. 6 stars!
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: I only took the monopod parts so I could fit it in my backpack easily. In the end
customer_reviews.text: The product feels well-made. Very lightweight. On the trip to Alaska, I only took the monopod parts so I could fit it in my backpack easily. In the end, I only used it once for panning across the horizon. Returning from the trip, I used the tripod a lot because it was very light and easy to use. It made taking shots of the blooms in the garden much easier, especially since it can go much lower than my older tripods. Similar tripods cost much more, some even weigh more. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JavaBorn

customer_reviews.title: Legs Are Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Legs are wobbly when fully extended with camera mounted. I like the ball head, but it seems too small for fine adjustments. I've been using it for tabletop photography and doubt its durability in the field. I like its compactness when completely collapsed. You might spend a few more dollars and get a more substantial tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Socci

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is excellent. I purchased it after reading many reviews and can say I can see why they are overwhelmingly positive. Its sturdy enough that I used it on a hike in Tahoe to get some great picks in some challenging terrain. With the 3 levels you can easily get perfect balance on any shot. You can also use it as a monopod or even add a phone holder and it becomes a selfie stick. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett James

customer_reviews.title: Bad handling from shipping
customer_reviews.text: Regrettably I must write a negative review. Upon opening the package I found 4 of the flip lock tabs broken off. Trying to get a hold of the company to see if they can send replacement parts to fix the tripod. If not then I will have to send it back for a refund. Looks like it was a result of rough shipping or poor storage. On a good note it does look like a nice tripod, simple to use and the detachable monopod leg is really cool!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Allard

customer_reviews.title: Best tripod I 've used so far
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tripod for my Nikon D800 E and Tamron 150-600 mm lens ! Very smooth motion when turning and handled this combination of a heavy camera and huge lens very well with no issues . Far superior than the cheesy Manfrotto I bought from Best Buy some years back for close to $100 and eventually became a fragile flimsy nightmare . You won't lose on this one, I promise !
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact tripod but overstated load capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Can fold up and fit in small backpack. Looks nice, functionally promising. However the ball head cannot come close to the 26.5lb load capacity stated for the tripod. With a 9lb camera+lens, the ball head is unable to maintain/balance the camera. To be clear the I mounted using the lens collar rather than the camera itself. Otherwise this appears to be a very fine, convenient & capable tripod/head combo given the price being asked for.
customer_reviews.author: Nozama Fer Scots

customer_reviews.title: Missing level
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good tripod but it's poorly advertised. The description of the item states "The ball-head also has two built-in levels which allows you to get the straightest shot possible.", unfortunately the item that I received only came with one level. If you scroll through the picture of the item you will notice that even in their pictures the level is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Marco De Leonardis

customer_reviews.title: Do not let the price fool you!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of skeptical of this tripod, specially with the selling price, but the tripod met every expectation with flying colors. I have done several long exposures ( 10 seconds - 90 seconds) and have yet to encounter camera/tripod shake. Could not be happier with the tripod. It folds down to almost nothing and it is fairly light weight. I took it on a recent trip to Cancun and I am so glad I brought this. Got some amazing shots that could not be achieved hand held.
customer_reviews.author: Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable and Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I do photography as a hobby and reley on a durable but compact size tripod for my trips. I went on a trip with the Ranger 55’ and the legs starting to fall apart within the second day of my trip. The plastic pieces that are to hold the legs in place became loose and eventually fell apart. I was not satisfied with this tripod. Poorly made and not reliable even for the most simple shots.
customer_reviews.author: CL M

customer_reviews.title: For the price it rocks
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tripod. But maybe because my other two stink. Good price . It does struggle a little bit when I put on my big heavy lenses but I expected that. Small and easy to travel with. My first ball head and I love that whole concept. Got it as it had the mono pod feature. Which I love. Not professional grade but I'm not a professional so win, win. I did pick up a couple of extra camera bases off ebay that work well. I tend to misplace them. All and all very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit - good value
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for a year for both a spotting scope and DSLR with long lens. We have a versa mount allowing us to switch. It deploys okay, but takes a little time to adjust and set up, but we find it workable. Overall it is reasonably solid and packs well. For the money, we drag it where ever we need and it is holding up well. (I have not used the monopod mode as I have an independent monopod with a versa plate, so no review on that part.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: No excuse for leaving the tripod at home
customer_reviews.text: Great Tripod for travel and surprisingly sturdy. One leg can be removed and attached to removable center column to form a tripod. Legs fold up into a compact length and fits nicely into the well padded tripod bag which is equipped with an adjustable strap for carrying..The center column can be removed and inverted for photographing subjects that are close to the ground..
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: perfection.
customer_reviews.text: It's everything I wanted in a tripod. low price, high quality I have only used it a few times but it's very adjustable to what you need. the knobs secure tightly but also are easy to loosen when needed the plate that slides in is a little tight, have to make sure the screw is folded in, but otherwise its amazing I look forward to using the monopod feature
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality but light, compact and a decent head.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality leaves something to be desired, as it is used more it seems to be wearing quickly. The rotating locks seem to have come loose, without pinching them, they spin freely, the legs wobble slightly when fully extended. It is fine for loads until ~8lbs but anything heavier (full frame with a telephoto lens for example) and it begins to lose some sturdiness
customer_reviews.author: Chester Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, very pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Last year I had purchased the meFOTO tripod for ~$200 on my way to a shoot and found it extremely clunky in operation and was not a fan at all. I returned it the next day. I looked around a little and usually trust amazon reviews pretty well, so I went with this one. WOW! Right out of the nice carrying bag I could tell this was a well-made product. It may not be as light as a hiking one, but I am not taking it hiking. I love the way the leg angles lock in, the nobs all feel very secure and the ball head is smooth. Perfect tripod for my T3i.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod, smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. Smaller than expected but I should've paid more attention to its 57" height. The tripod does feels pretty solid and durable, with rubber grips that work well. I love that I can use it as a monopod which increases my options greatly. Ball head is pretty sweet with no complaints on it yet. I do sometimes feel like I wouldve liked it to be a little bigger cause when its fully extended I feel it should be a little bigger but again like I mentioned that was my fault for not measuring the 57" in real life. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt feel light
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by two things, one...its very well made. Feels durable and there isn't a cheap component to it. The second, because it's well made, it's also heavier than I thought it would be. It could be more packable if there wasn't so much space between the folded down legs. That said, I am happy with it. The quality is great, the head pans well and its a good price ($67). I will take it backpacking and will be happy with its quality, but will wish it were a little more packable and light.
customer_reviews.author: Tom McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all if you need something ultra portable
customer_reviews.text: Need something some for airline travel to easily fit with everything else I lug along. Perfect size and great bag. Everything seems fine and I foresee no problems. Only thing I didn't like were that the legs seemed a little wobbly at the end of their reach until the are clamped down with the leg extensions clamps. I do not see this as a problem but something i'll be aware of when extending the legs. Can't be built like a tank AND be ultra portable and have a useful height. Good mix of both.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, compact, perfect for any photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Cannon Rebel T-6. I have used multiple tri-pods in my line of work and this is by far my favorite. I manage social media for a restaurant group and have used this to take both photos and video. It's very easy to operate and adjust, not to mention it's very compact. It travels well and breaks down to a manageable size so that it's easy to carry. I recommend this to all of my fellow photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for great price
customer_reviews.text: We did hours of research to get a quality tripod that was small enough to travel. It fit the bill perfectly. Even bought the part so can attach GoPro to the tripod. Very lightweight to carry. Excellent product for the price. You can spend a fortune on tripods. This little fellow did all we asked of it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod so far. Very easy to use, light weight and durable. Recommend to all photographers as it's a 2-in-1 as a very flexible tripod and also can be a very sturdy mono-pod. I've already done many outdoor landscape and portrait events and it's held up perfectly. For the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray-Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Make all of your other photographer friends jealous with this thing. Can't beat the value and features that come with this tripod. Primary reason I bought it is that I wanted a tripod that could fit inside my carry-on luggage bag. The fact that it's sturdy, light, has controls that function well, and pans smoothly are all pluses! I would not recommend using the monopod as a hiking stick/aid, the rubber feet will wear out quickly if you do.
customer_reviews.author: S HEPNER

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS TRIPOD!
customer_reviews.text: There is so much cheap junk available. I was so unsure of what to buy this time. I just knew I didn't want to spend over $100. So glad I made this purchase. We Vlog weekly. Always using my new TYCKA Ranger tripod. It is awesome. Once you get used to the best adjustments for your shots, the movements are smooth and the ability to get in perfect position is awesome. The locks stay tight even for my heavy DSLR and lenses. No worries. Buy this tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Krefft

customer_reviews.title: Well made and very versatile tripod.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Aluminum version. Considering the price, this is a well made portable tripod. Heavy duty enough for reliable usage but compact and of reasonable weight for carrying. Very versatile, Tripod, and monopod, with very low to the ground configurations. I noticed several questions about the extra short tube and strange "bag" that were included in the package. I asked Tycka what they were and they sent me the attached pictures which illustrates their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Fly

customer_reviews.title: High Quality / Durable
customer_reviews.text: So impressed with this tripod. I bought a cheap tripod ($30) a few months ago and it was garbage. I can’t believe I could have just spent a little more then and saved myself frustration and time. It is very sturdy and feels like a high end tripod. I used it on our trip out West and it did great in sand and the Zion Narrows! Here are some shots I took with it. Don’t sell yourself short! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Keasters

customer_reviews.title: Stable, Inexpensive, Excellent, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I've used a LOT of cheap tripods and this one DOES NOT feel cheap. It's the most substantial tripod I've ever used that cost less than $400 and the ball head is more than usable, even for fluid panning. I HIGHLY recommend this product. Perfect for "Disney" or other parks that require you to use a compact tripod where you still need stability.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Melton

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjustable tripod that is lightweight, sturdy and fun to use. Fantastic value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tripod! The ball mount makes it easy to acquire the right camera angle, and the other bubble level makes it easy to keep your camera shooting straight. It folds up nicely and fits into the carrying case without any hassle and although it's very lightweight, it is very sturdy. We set this camera on the Ravelli ATD Professional Tripod Dolly and the two worked together perfectly. Great tripod for a great pice. (During one photo shoot, one of the other guys had a far heavier, far more expensive tripod and we ended up using this one for almost everything. He is now planning to purchase this product for his own use.)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Stop debating! Buy it already.
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered. I ordered this tripod after reading the reviews and decided it was worth a shot. Bit am I glad I did. I needed a lightweight tripod that’s a I can throw in my bad and carry with me during my outings and this does not fall short. It’s very durable, sturdy, and pleasing to the eye. It fits perfectly in a small photography backpack, therefore it will def fit in the bigger bags. I am ecstatic! If you’re debating, don’t! This is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Aki Rivz

customer_reviews.title: Very strong for a mid-priced tripod
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a Manfrotto MKCOMPACTADV-BK which turned out to be defective right out of the box. I repurchased this Ranger tripod and I am glad that the Manfrotto was defective, this tripod is very sturdy, well built, and should last a long time. All of the clamps are well built and they hold good. The screw knobs on the head are very easy and smooth to use, it does not take much tightening to hold the ball head steady in place. Also, this tripod has more features and was cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: jfsjr61

customer_reviews.title: Good, stable, easy to use tripod
customer_reviews.text: The tripod works decently, I’ve had no issues with it, it’s light enough to carry with me for special occasions. And it’s durable enough to handle the weight of my camera and remain stable. The one unfortunate thing that happened was when I received the product, the bag for the tripod, the zipper came broken.
customer_reviews.author: Frida

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I pulled this tripod out of the bag, I knew it was going to be good! It is slightly heavy, therefore; you know it's going to be sturdy. There doesn't seem to be any cheap parts. Everything looks good. The overall design and look are appealing. Not sure what other people look for in a tripod, but this one meets my needs. It holds up my Canon 6d Mark II, is sturdy, and compact. The ball stays put once tightened. The gold is just so pretty! Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mai

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels good
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression 20180124 *Overall build quality looks good. *Has a nice weight to it. *Mostly metal construction. *Plastic lever locks for the legs. (only thing that I see is plastic) *separate locks for the panning and tilt. Most of the information is already available on the description. The only thing that I am a little confused about before purchasing is no handle for panning. Not a big deal. I'm excited to start taking this out. Will update after a couple of sessions
customer_reviews.author: Khoi D. Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a well-designed product!
customer_reviews.text: I am an on-the-go landscape photographer! I have a heavier and sturdier tripod. But I needed a lightweight collapsible tripod for traveling. Although I have not used it yet I have played with it by opening it up I'm trying out the different leg positions. I am amazed at the Quality and workmanship that went into this design. For the price it can't be beat. I would say that it matches the quality of my $200 manfrotto tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very good, affordable Tripod.
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is actually excellent. I carried it while hiking for a while and it didn’t really cause any fatigue. Then I took it out on top of a mountain and took great, stable pictures. Just need to make sure everything is correctly fastened if it seems wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymouss

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tripod for several months and took it with me on a one month trip. Overall decent tripod. Lightweight and easy to set up. The rubber from the plate screw is peeling off but I believe it may be because I'm trying to screw on my camera too tight, but it does keep loosening. The tripod can't take the weight of my Nikon D810 with a 24-70mm lens when trying to do portrait angles. The zipper on the bag it came with also broke within a month.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to change and use
customer_reviews.text: A perfect tripod for anyone. Being disabled I need a light weight tripod that is easy to use and sturdy. This is the best tripod for anyone to use. Easy and fast to go from short to talk in seconds. This one is the newer one it's even better than the one I got two years ago. I rebought this as soon as the old one needed replacement. Five stars all around. You won't be disappointed with this one. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Zo

customer_reviews.title: Great build. Works perfectly and very stable.
customer_reviews.text: Sick. Solid construction, gets pretty compact for the build. Worth it, don’t forget to buy a remote for longer exposure shots or set your camera on a timer. Pressing any camera will move it slightly. However this one does sway or feel like the cheaper alternatives. Solid build for a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Meech

customer_reviews.title: best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is ridiculous in the amount of features it offers for the price. It has proven sturdy enough for macro shots, it is extremely versatile in how you can place it, it can be converted into a stellar monopod within seconds... I have owned numerous manfotto tripods over the years, and this compares to them just fine and 1/3rd the price.
customer_reviews.author: vtshopper

customer_reviews.title: nice looking, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: strong, nice looking, easy to use, I had many tripod before, but this is the best, it holds my D750 with Battery Grip plus heavy lens for hours without moving a mm perfect for time-lapse.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, comes with a pretty pouch to carry it
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect more or less from this value. It's compact, sturdy, comes with a pretty pouch to carry it. 4 out of 5 stars because the head does NOT hold 26lbs with ease. If you try to take a portrait pic with a 70-200 lens attached to a proper DSLR it will slip... but what can you expect from a such a cheap setup? this is just a good portable tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great travel tripod
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to fit in my carry on/backpack for travel. Light and packs down small. Can't beat the price for what you get. Only negative is the lever for the leg locks. They are mostly plastic and I keep worrying that they are going to break. Also no way to adjust/tighten the leg locks that I've found in the even the loosen from repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: kadac00

customer_reviews.title: I found the tripod to be easy to use and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer so my ratings will reflect that. I found the tripod to be easy to use and very sturdy. Even with have a Canon 80d and a heavy 200 -400 MM zoom lens the tripod remained sturdy (even when attaching to the camera body instead of the lens mount). As others have noted the tripod is very compact and folds up nicely. I found the swivel action to be smooth especially for panoramas. There is a bit of a creep after tightening down the ball, I found aiming the camera a bit above the subject helps. Bang for the buck I do not think you will find a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Victor B

customer_reviews.title: Okay but beware of finger snap during folding
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the quality and ease of use are great but one thing about it is really annoying: every time I collapse it the small levers pinch my fingers since they need to be pressed and go into full extension before retracting.
customer_reviews.author: Adi Osovsky

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far, but logo is different.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very sturdy and pans very well. As this is my first ball head tripod, I don’t have a lot to compare it to but looking forward to putting it through it’s paces. One issue I have is that the logo on the front is the name of the company and not the “Rangers” logo. This doesn’t have any bearing on the function but i really liked that logo and it’s always a bit of a disappointment to not get exactly what was pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I love how compact and sturdy these tripods are. they have a ton of adjustments, not just the legs. and they come in really neat zipper bags ( although the zipper broke on one of mine after about a month ) but i don't really need a carrying bag for what i use them for. They are very well built and look very professional. The mono pod feature is definitely nice to have!
customer_reviews.author: Zac Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made and comes with a case
customer_reviews.text: Well made and reasonably light. I had previously Gotten an Amazon Basic like this but made from Carbon so was lighter but it is no longer in stock and this was similar in size and price. It is for my 19 year old granddaughter who is trying to get into DSLR photography.
customer_reviews.author: ChrispyCreamy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact Mount
customer_reviews.text: My first tripod. Got it for my mirrorless to use during my travels, and it's been a keeper. Ultra portable, and compact enough to fit it in my backpack and purse, easy to set up and put away, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tripod to have in your arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod! I use it for astrophotography & waterfalls. I've even used it in a few rivers. For the price point, I cant imagine I'd find anything better in it's class. I have nothing negative to say and I WILL buy one again whenever I destroy or loose this one. Comes with a nice carry case as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: ... for the past 6 months and have not been disappointed. It has been dropped
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for the past 6 months and have not been disappointed. It has been dropped, kicked, and beat the heck up but keeps on going. Very lightweight, fits in my camera backpack's water bottle holder. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: For being a lightweight tripod, it is definitely more stout than I was expecting. I had it set in the middle notches for a flatter setup and it had no issues in ~35mph sustained winds, just had the anti-shock set for double the exposure length and photos were clean. Haven't had a chance to really test out the monopod aspect, but hoping it is a nice feature to shoot some skiing photos with soon. Spring/summer hiking trips will be the next true test, as it isn't as compact as I was hoping for, but it has it's own bag that I am going to add some loops to allow for attaching it to my pack easier.
customer_reviews.author: C. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: excellent travel tripod
customer_reviews.text: The thing is light, but stable, The legs telescope precisely and stay where you put them. The ball head is also easy to lock and stays put. Nice touches with the extra speed attachment for your camera, the center pole that can be used as a mono-pod, and the carry bag is stout. I've used it a bunch and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Moutoux

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for blogging. It is better than I expected. It is a great bargain since it is pro quality on a budget. One drawback is the height. Of it were taller it would be unbeatable. Perfect for blogging and as a monopod. Props to you.
customer_reviews.author: Dcn Marcelino

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality for the price. Took backpacking in Havasu, it is a bit heavy if you're trying to stay light, but unless you want to spend hundreds on ultra light gear, this is better than a lot out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love It but can't get near Sea Water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be perfect for our trip. We went on a whale watching tour and I had to cover it up totally. I read the instructions when I got it and noticed that it advised against Ocean or Sea Water, I can't remember which but they are basically both bad for it. I kept it safe by covering it and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first!
customer_reviews.text: This tripod was great at first. I bought it about 8 months ago and after awhile it started falling apart. The tripod head at the top where the rubber black band meets started to come apart. I was using it for weddings, but I wouldn't purchase tripod again. I had to duck tape it in the middle of a wedding it is simply look unprofessional. I would buy something more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Hottie Tadi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect compact tripod for backpacking. It's light and sturdy. The ball-head is smooth and stays where you put it, and the knobs are machined well and lock with confidence. The legs are a bit stiff to deploy, so I had to adjust them a bit with the included Allen key.. 57" is a bit shorter than I am used to, but it's a solid enough platform for the field and can lay flat, which is why I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian of Sacramento

product_meta.title: TYCKA Rangers 56” Compact Travel Tripod, Lightweight Aluminum Camera Tripod for DSLR Camera with 360° Panorama Ball Head and Carry Bag
feature_bullets: ➽LOW ANGLE AND MACRO VIEW ENABLED: With an included short attachment(3.6”), you can shoot at a height of 7.87”. And the central pole can be inverted to allow for low angle shooting and macro photography.

➽DETACHABLE MONOPOD: Our TYCKA Rangers Tripod also features a removable leg (with foam grip) that can be used as an alpenstock for hiking or walking. Or it can be converted into a monopod when attached to the included ball-adaptor to meet your shooting needs.

➽EASY SET-UP AND PORTABLE: Four-segment poles with quick release flip-locks allow you to adjust the tripod’s height from 14" up to 56" in seconds. The TYCKA Rangers tripod folds down to a compact 14” and weighs only 2.9lbs, allowing you to take it with you anywhere.

➽360°PANORAMA AND ULTRA STABLE: With two independent control knobs, the specially designed ball-head can rotate 360°allowing you to get that perfect shot every time. The tripod fork is crafted using precision CNC machining to ensure the highest quality construction.
➽GUARANTEE: Backed by our industry-leading 24-Month warranty. We stand behind our products. Please contact us if you need any help or if you have any questions!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,028 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
